review: There's a Red Robin a half an hour from my house. Why did it take me 850 miles and god knows how many years to try them? I dunno. This Red Robin was clean and the service was well kept. I ordered an iced tea which somehow got lost in translation as Hi-C, but I'll chalk that up to my yankee accent...because a passing waitress quickly rectified it. I had the California burger. Avocado ftw. That is all. Also, get "some pink" so your burger isn't totally overdone.

I called in an order for a Ghost style tavern burger.  I had a free burger for my upcoming birthday. I ordered it to go with honey mustard and campfire sauce.  When I arrived at the restaurant (extremely slow inside) I had to wait for well over five minutes as employees just kept walking past me telling me it would be a few minutes. A few of them just walked past me and were standing behind the line goofing off, laughing. Finally somebody asked if I wanted to sit in the bar or the restaurant. Told them I was here to pick up a to go order.  I was directed to the bar area to speak with the bartender.  I asked him if both of my sauces were in my box of food and he said yes.  I got home in less than five minutes to find that my fries were already cold all the way through and neither one of my sauces were in the box.  The only sauce that they had given me were a few mustard and ketchup packets which I specifically told him I did not want when I was standing there waiting for my food. I've been going to Red Robin locations in the Seattle and Tacoma area for years and have always enjoyed the level of service and food immensely. I had several birthday parties in a row there! After my first experience at the location here in Greenville, SC, I don't think I'll be visiting another Red Robin again unless I take a vacation and stop in for dinner while I'm in Seattle.

Stopped at this Red Robin twice on on a family road trip to Georgia.  The first time was out of necessity, as my 3 kids were very hungry.  The second time we visited was on our return trip and this stop was part of the travel plans.  The kids loved the menu, which has at times been tough for us as the kids have very different tastes.  The wife and I were covered too, with some fairly healthy options (had vegetarian option as well).  Friendly, attentive staff.  Probably one of the best chain restaurant stops for us.

Their food is delicious! They also have allergen free menus so it is a great place for those with food allergies! Service is also amazing! Food comes quickly and waiters work with you to make sure you don't accidentally order anything that could trigger an allergic reaction. I have tried many of their burgers and they are all delicious!

Came here with my sister! Service was great. Place was clean. It's a chain.... Nothing much to say, except that this is the place to go if you want a good burger that not every restaurant has. I like their seasonal specials, especially the Octoberfest Burger

Deluxe Burger or a good wrap. Bottomless fries means eat until they come out of your ears. :-) Lunch or dinner...no problem. Outside seating if you want. One of my burger spots in this area. Folks are nice and welcoming.
I had the all American cheese burger it was good the fries had a seasoning on them that was a little to much. Next time I'll ask for no seasoning.

I'll start by saying, it was my first, & more than likely my last time eating at Red Robin. The service was stellar, but the food was mediocre. - I ordered an "All-American Patty melt" which sounded quite tasty, but was not at all up to par & was forced to it send back. My second order "Red's Tavern Double Burger" was no better. Aside from "Bottomless Fries" (unlimited) & great service, I was let down.
Good burgers, salads, sandwiches and shakes.  Nice place for all ages.

I really wish I could like this place. But every time my husband and I show up, they can never get our burgers cooked to order. He want his medium rare, I medium well. Every time they are overcooked or undercooked. Really, is it that hard. Sorry, better places in this area.

The service was beyond awesome! The waitress was very friendly! I had an allergy and she kindly brought out a special menu for me! I recommend this place for anyone with allergies and wants to eat out. They are very careful to not cross contaminant the food.    I got the keep it simple burger and it was delicious!! Savory, moist, not dry or burnt! Can not wait til I return! The manager there check on each table. The service and food was good.

location: H Street Corridor/Atlas District/Near Northeast, Washington, DC
review: When I lived in Greenville, I couldn't get enough of this place. The strawberry drinks were amazing, but a bit pricey. The burgers are amazing, and especially for vegetarians like me. (Veggie patty option, not the greatest patty but still ok) I've tried the onion soup which was better than I expected. Salads are good as well. Sometimes the service can be a little slow getting to the table but always great when they are there. Really miss this place!

I am a seasoned Red Robin consumer, but I was recently at this location (for the first time) with my boyfriend and his parents, and this was their first time at a Red Robin. Everything was delicious, hot, and served to us in a very timely manner. There was no wait for a table, even at the typical dinner hour. Our waiter was Joel, and he was awesome. Very friendly and attentive. Excellent location.

Lackluster service and lackluster meal. We had the bacon cheeseburger, ordered medium. The burger was so gray that it looked either fake or bad. Slimy lettuce on too didn't help. The best part of the meal was the appetizer: pretzel bites.
Service was slow, burger was mediocre, a little pricey for what you're getting.

I am one of Red Robin's biggest fans. Despite not having any kids of my own, and generally not enjoying kid-friendly places, Red Robin is usually at the top of my list of places to eat. Ironic, I know. In fact, where I am from, I know of and have been to seven different locations! I like to go there so much that my husband is no longer a fan.  However, our experience at this location last night was absolutely horrible. We were pretty much ignored the entire night. If it were not for our attempt to show a relative what good food Red Robin had, we would have complained and walked out. It about killed us to leave a tip at all, but know what it's like to hold a restaurant gig. We seriously considered writing in a negative amount, but figured we wouldn't get away with it. There isn't much left to say but that our experience at this location was extremely disappointing. I was surprised to read some of the other bad reviews about this location before we arrived, as some of them were hard to believe (especially the one about the roach). But after our experience, I might actually believe it!

The dishes were dirty and the food was over cooked.  Nasty, just nasty.  I even stopped a family in the parking lot and advised against feeding their young children there lest they get food poisoning.  Cost was pricey.

PRICE: A little high for a hamburger place. FOOD: Excellent hamburgers. BOTTOMLESS STEAK FRIES!!* (*Bottomless steak fries with most/all hamburger orders.) The shakes are very good and plentiful. STAFF: The waitstaff is good, however, sometimes they do not have enough staff. This is likely an issue with management. OTHER: Overall very good but every once in a while you're going to wait...and wait. The food has always been very good, however.

First time for my husband and I. We were greeted upon arrival. I would've like it more if the hostess up front would open the doors when customers arrive. But I'll leave it at that, since I can open my own door.  Anyways, the waitress that we had was pretty nice and she tried her best to be friendly. We got some chicken bites for the appetizers for $5, and it wasn't the best. I would give it a 5/10. (It tastes like the frozen chicken nuggets in the bag you would buy from Walmart.) Not anything I would recommend for a starter. But we both got ourselves sandwiches. I would say it was pretty tasty. I also liked how the fries are endless. Once you finish them you can get more. So I was happy about that. I took advantage of that. Haha!   Overall our first time there was good and I would return there again.

Normally I love Red Robin but my last trip was awful!   My burger was over done.  There was food all over the floor.   No one even bothered to sweep it up the entire time we were there.  I asked for napkins 3 times and never got them.

Not the cheapest and not the tastiest but a great variety of burgers. Clean location with great service. I went with the WHISKEY RIVER® BBQ burger and it was an exciting combination of tastes you could taste the hint of bourbon in the sauce.

I love this place and their burgers, even if they are a little more pricey, but the last 2 times service has been really slow. Hard to even get a second order of the "bottomless" french fries. The waitress blamed it on the kitchen, but she also seemed like she had only been doing the job for about a month, so im not sure what the turnover rate is there.   That being said, food is still great and so are the fries. Never tried milkshakes but i was told they were good also.  With other options available now on woodruff road, it will probably be a while before i go back there again, not that it will really change anything, however.

Went for lunch on a Saturday.  They had fast, friendly service. Joey our waiter was excellent and made sure our drinks were always full. He definitely made the experience of going to red robin more enjoyable and we will definitely be back again. I highly recommend coming here with your family.

Amanda was great.  She was was lively and saw to our needs.  Party of 4.  My double tavern and sweet potato fries were cold.  My son ordered the clucks and shrimp.  He got two very puny strips of over breaded chicken.  He's 15, 6'2", and weighs 197.  He was unhappy with the serving size while I was surprised at it.  Everyone else's order seemed to be ok.
Nearly died of starvation waiting for my burger. Guess whoever was working couldn't catch the cow out back, 45 min to get a burger is ridiculous!!!

Fun atmosphere. Great place to bring the kids and family. My burger, the Royal, that consists of bacon, cheese, lettuce, tomato, and a fried egg is a really great choice. Only complaint was that the bottom bun was a little soggy. Our fantastic server, Ed, could answer any question we posed to him about the menu. It was great to see all the staff working well together, and playing their roles well. A friendly manager found his way to each table and greeted guests and made sure they were happy. Love it.
we loved the food!!!!! great price, you can't beat the bottomless sides and drinks. Our server was great, she was friendly and polite. We will definitely stop by again on our road trip.
Came in for lunch today. Took a moment to be greeted at hostess stand but the hostess was very nice. Food was awsome and my wife was very impressed being her first time visiting.

Definitely not what it used to be. The last few times our visit has been sub-par. The wait was 25 minutes (with open/empty tables) and then our food took 35 minutes to come to the table. Once it did one order was wrong and the fries were cold. Needless to say refills on our drinks we're hard to come by.  Also the restrooms need HELP! You can see each other between stalls.

Came in for lunch yesterday(8-16-15)with a friend. Surprisingly they weren't overly crowded for a Sunday afternoon,but it took a good 10 minutes to get a table for 2 when there were lots of empty tables. We ordered our food and drinks right away. It took about 10 minutes to get our water and we waited 30-40 minutes for our food and around 20 minutes for a refill. Our food was good,but it was all cold by the time it got to the table and it wasn't exactly fun eating cold food after paying over $10 per person. The only thing was that our server was pretty nice and she did the best she could I guess. I've always loved red robin,but it wasn't a hit with me this time.

Horrible service. There was a lot of people waiting in the waiting area and half the restaurant had open tables. We waited 25 minutes before getting seated and another 15 minutes waiting at the table with absolute no service. Management just kept walking around all confused and servers were obviously understaffed. Worst experience ever.
Very busy happening place. Food good, service depends on the day. But great food when u get it the way u like it!

First off, let me tell you, this place gets extremely busy on the weekends!! Long wait for tables on busier days, so if you don't like that, I would come here for lunch when it is less busy. And since I last ate here in August 2014, it seems to have remodeled. There's a new sign and the arcade games are gone! Our server, James (bearded) introduced us to the new ordering menu/kiosk thing, and it is awesome. You can put in an order for you appetizer or dessert, and even tip the server via your credit/debit card! Cool technology. On my recent visit on 9/7/2015, I started off with these "pretzel bites" which were absolutely tasty, and then had this "Big Ghost" burger with pepper jack cheese, fried jalepenos and some kind of hot sauce. I get my burger cooked medium-rare. It filled my stomach up, and so did the bottomless fries!  Red Robin is great, but come during lunch or dinner on the weekdays. :)
So slow it's ridiculous! Have been here an hour and no food yet and it's not busy!! Terrible servo they seem to have decided that their table side electronic replaced the need for service

25 minute wait, 10 minute wait to see our waitress after being seated, took forever to get our drinks and food. My husband could barely get some more fries much less anything else. The food was still good but we were there at least an hour longer than we should have been, just sitting around waiting for service each time we needed it. Not a good experience especially with a toddler who was ready to go a lot earlier than we were able to.

I went here on Veteran's Day, so INCREDIBLY busy!!! My waitress, Sandra, was great. She was great, very busy, but attentive and thought ahead for me so I wouldnt have to wait due to the volume of people in the restaurant. Then when checking out with the do it yourself table thing it didnt take my 20% off with my reward card. I asked my waitress about it and she brought out the manager. He didnt know why it was doing that, but gave me a free dessert to make up for it!! So nice and really on top of their customer service.

Red Robin is my pig-out place, which isn't great news for my jeans waistband. Luckily I'm busy enough that I can't go too often. But then I don't get to pig out. It's a terrible fix to be in.  I tend to go the low maintenance route when I order, getting the most basic burger on the menu (because what I'm more interested in is the yummy steak fries). It used to be called the Natural Burger, then they changed it to Keep It Simple or something. Hard to adjust to since I forget I'm not home in PA where we'd always end up with the same server who understood what we meant when we demanded a Natty.  My real addiction is the chili. Now, being a chili freak, I can't say they have a sophisticated chili system. Mostly it tastes like they dumped a LOT of chili powder in a pot and added some beans and meat. It works, though, when the craving hits. One minor gripe about that is, at this location, it seems to have gotten a lot saltier in recent times. Borders on pucker-up levels of salty at times. If they dialed back on that, my chili powder bomb would be perfect. We don't tend to have issues with service or overcrowding because, come on. It's Woodruff Road. If you're out there in that mess on a weekend and giving lousy reviews for delays, you kinda are asking for a bad time. Stick to off peak times and cool your jets if it's busy. They're servers, not indentured servants.

Well we happened to come in around lunch time on ties. A special deal day. We both ordered Banzai burgers , one fry and one broccoli , Thai dipping sauce and ranch,a beer and the new adult  root beer float and got the Tavern double for free. Also a mini wedge for first. She forgot the ice cream in the glass for the float. Then our three burgers came.  No sauces, no broccoli and no salad ahead of time. Burgers were cooked wrong, pineapple was not grilled enuf ( cold).  Waitress blaming kitchen. This is the way I see it. Waitress outta know what the order was and bring it all out at same time!! Helllloooo. Then she sent Steve the manager out. We talked and I noticed the cooks shuving fries in the rings.... No gloves !!! Not except able sorry. One gals hair flying around not pulled back either... Not good sorry.

Loooong wait for a halfway empty restaurant. The hostess spent 10 minutes wiping menus then went to clear a table in the bar. Seemed like a bunch of standing around and no one cleaning the  tables. Our sever was good. The food looked like it went thru a shredder before it made it to the table. Beer was cold

This was my first visit to a Red Robin. I've heard they had great burgers and I was not disappointed. I had the Southern Charm burger and my husband had the Banzai burger. The Southern Charm was a sweet thing. I had a little sweet tooth and this hit the spot with its savory and sweet palate. My husband wasn't as pleased with the Banzai burger. There wasn't anything wrong with the food, it just didn't fit what he was craving. He would recommend more lineapple, though. The service was timely a day friendly, however the cleanliness wasn't exactly top notch. I wasn't necessarily grossed out. The floors felt slick and greasy and all the empty tables were dirty when they took us back to be seated.

Worst experience ever for myself and husband's first time at Red Robin. 35 minute long wait for a seat on a busy Saturday was made worse when we sat waiting for about 10mina for our server to come. forgetting to seat us. Our server claimed no one told her she had to serve us, and promised that she'd make it up to us (which she never did). Our food took another 45 minutes to come out. The burger and fries were good, but the service was below par. Our server seemed less than enthusiastic maybe because she was tired, or she was not good at her job. The good food does not compensate for the bad service.  Also, I saw a host/server brush crumbs off the table next to us with his bare hands. And the floor at that table was dirty with fries, crayons, food from the previous  customers. Red Robin employees didn't even sweep the floor under the table to make sure it was clean for the next customers.  The long wait, and poor service are not worth the burger unless you have 2 hours to waste. I definitely would not be going back.

After my poor experience, I was contacted and offered a gift card to give Red Robin a try again. I've never had this happen before and it was definitely appreciated. If this review was just based on customer service it would be 5 stars. Since last time I went it was a packed Friday night, I decided to try an early dinner on a weekday. This was a better time to come, the server was attentive and on top of it. The food still wasn't the best but it was ok. The burgers were a little overcooked and were just warm, not hot. Still it was an improvement from the last visit. Would I come back here again? Maybe but there is definitely better options in Greenville. I would give it 3.5 stars, the food being 3 stars and the service being 4.

Well I ended up here because Bacon brothers public house was closed for expansion. Basically I was defeated and went to something by my hotel since all other meals are planned out for the week. Anyway, my burger was good even though it was more medium well then medium rare. I got the black and blue with sweet potato fries and they were over cooked. Got the steak fries and they were a lot better.

My boyfriend and I went in on Sunday, 01/03/16 and was immediately seated at a high top across from the bar. Our highly inattentive waitress came over finally, after delivering the food to the table next to us, to take our order.  Shortly after, another couple was seated next to us and waited 30 minutes for a waitress to acknowledge them to take their drink order... which never happened, they decided to leave.  We waited over 45 minutes, with only one refill on one of our waters, that was practically slammed down on our table as she quickly walked away.  I completely understand when a restaurant is busy that there will be a wait and frenzied waiters/waitresses, but I expect a good wait staff to check on the table from time to time.  It was completely unacceptable and we decided to leave. I'm not sure that we'll be back.

The food is good but they know if they have a lot of business it's time to increase the staff....we decided to sit at the bar since the wait was so long for a regular table and the poor bartender was answering the phones and waiting on us at the bar but never the less she was very apologetic and kind so at the end of the day we'll be back to eat yayyyy. Only because of her

I went the day before Valentine's Day so of course there was a wait but I had the best time here. The servers were not under pressure from the crowded restaurant and it didn't take forever for our food to come out. Food was delicious! The only thing was the bathrooms were not clean whatsoever BUT that didn't affect me that much since the service was so great!

Literally the worst experience we have ever had here. 25 mins for a table in an empty restaurant. Cold food, slow service, just absolutely awful. It's a mediocre place to begin with, but awful food & service just seal the deal. Avoid at all costs.

Service has been terrible the last two visits (2/2016 and 3/19/2016).  The last visit , we waited 30-45 minutes to be seated (which would be understandable if it was packed - but there were a lot of empty tables when we got back like they didn't have enough staff).  Once we were seated, no one came to take our drink order, so after 20 minutes, we walked out.  I actually spoke with the greeter and (she was very nice and apologetic) on the way out.  She offered to get the manager and begged us to come back in and let her make it right, but with two little kids and my wife already loading them in the car, it wasn't worth it.  She asked for my contact info, so I gave her my business card and she said she would have a manager contact me.  I waited a few days for a call, but never received a call back.  I also contacted their corporate on their website and this was their canned response: I have alerted both the 1125 Woodruff Rd., Suite 1400 Red Robin as well as their Regional Operations Director to this experience so that they may utilize your comments to help us strive to do better on your next visit. Still no contact from the manager or ROD. It's very unfortunate because we are usually  pretty understanding of issues and all, but with the lack of customer service we've been so frustrated we won't even go back for the free birthday burger with the loyalty card.  I don't think it is unreasonable to expect good service when you are paying $50 to take a family of four out to eat for one meal.

I should have lowered my expectations as soon as my boyfriend walked in a accurately noted that it smelled like Burger King. We came here because my boyfriend wanted McDonald's so I thought this was a good compromise. Should have just gone to McD's because it would have been about the same for about $40 less. Not that I'm a fan of fast food, but these comparisons should tell you all you need to know.  My biggest complaint is the Not Your Father's Root Beer Float. I like the beer so thought this would be fun, but for $7.49 I could have gotten a six pack and made it myself at home better than this. It probably sat at the bar for way too long because the foam had disappeared and the glass looked half empty by the time I got it. No spoon and the straw was way too short for the glass, so I kept having to dig for it and then finally turn the absurdly large glass upside down to finish it. I feel like a root beer float, alcoholic or not, is meant to be drank through a straw.  We also ordered Banzai boneless wings as an app, which were pretty good, but the chips they are served with were cold although kind of crispy. The waitress said they were supposed to be, but I think this was another case of waiting too long in the window. On the topic of service, the server was nice enough but they have these little touch screen devices on the tables to play games, order appetizers, pay, et cetera. Seems like a way to cut costs at the expense of service. While I've seen them in other restaurants, the amount of time she spent explaining how to order and appetizer off of it could have better spent offering her suggestions on a good starter. I'd much rather have a friendly server to interact with than a robot. I will say the burgers and fries were alright, but nothing above average. Again, not a fan of cheap fast food, but I would have been equally satisfied for much less cost going to the Golden Arches. Don't blow your money here, there a plenty of other great burger and fries joints on Woodruff-many locally owned- that would be more affordable and better quality that this. I know traffic can be awful, but even if you're famished it would be worth the extra few minutes. Actually, Carolina Ale House is in .1 miles away and much better than this, even though I've only been to the one downtown I can assure its better.

Absolutely disgusting. I found a big piece of damn curly hair in my burger. The manager gave us manager discount which was technically less than what you get from the rewards card. The food is awful. Don't go there. They're not clean.

At a high top in the bar area.  Server was attentive and never was in need of anything.  The food was good, although they didn't get my order right (requested no mayo, but was okay with it). This is an upscale experience.  Anyone comparing this place to a McDonald's or Burger King will be disappointed.  That's like comparing a craft beer to Coors Light.  The product is similar, but the experience is different.

Grease, grease, and more grease.  The onion rings and fries are very tasty but the grease will soak your napkin!  We wanted the broccoli but they had none, no salmon which was shown on line so we shared a burger...nothing special. No need to come back.
Great burgers and the beer is ice cold. Prices are a little steep, but the portions are generous and the service is fast and friendly.

my friend and i came her on a sunday night and were instantly seated. our server was friendly and checked up on us many times. food was delicious as always. i am always satisfied and left smiling. i highly recommend to all.

We were doubting about giving it another chance since we didn't have good experiences there before. This time we sat next to the bar and it was a wonderful experience. Our waitress I believe was the bartender, was friendly, checked on us few times and was accurate. The burgers were delicious and done how we asked. I have to say we will be back. Prices are ok, between 10-14$ for a burger with fries or broccoli.

If you can get past the prices, you will find one of the best burgers around. And the steak fries and sweet potato fries are delectable! I love the "endless sides" or "bottomless sides" (whatever they call them)...this helps to offset the price of the burger.  This was my first visit to a Red Robin, but to be quite honest, I don' know if I will go back. The food was superb - one of the best burgers I have ever had - and the service was excellent. It's just the prices. We had two adults and two children, and our bill was $52. Maybe we will reserve this place for special occasions, but we sure won't be going there on a regular basis. Despite these reservations/concerns, I DO recommend the place.

Prices are a bit high for a burger, but it is a good quality burger with bottomless fries..... unless your waitress drops off your food and disappears for a half hour. Empty glasses of tea, water and Coke all over the table. She finally reappears and asks if we need anything. Seriously. Clear view of the kitchen area and the staff is back there dancing and throwing kitchen towels. No, I am not kidding. She finally brings the bill and I can pay and leave. That is the highlight of the dining experience at this establishment.

So I was craving a hamburger and fries after not eating since 5 am today and so of course unlimited French fries is a no trainer! The place is phenomenally clean and has a great retro family/casual dining/bar. The prices are not fast food prices but average compared to it's competitors.  SANDRA was our server and man was she great! She had a lot going on but didn't miss a beat and took good care of us! My bourbon bacon burger was incredible but my friends Caesar salad was kind of terrible. The mud pie was amazing! I was too full but dinner was amazingly perfect!

The best thing about this place is that they have so MANY different types of gourmet burgers. But it don't stop there! With a wide variety of options just about anyone can find something they want. My personal favorite. The Red Robin burger! It's a big juicy burger with all the toppings including a egg cooked to your choice. Be sure to sign up for the rewards program to start getting freebies. They will also contribute portion of your bill to a school of your choosing. So go try them out!  Red Robin...  Yumm

I had not been here in several years. I was suprised at the service at 815 pm Sunday night. Even though they close at 10:00 , they were so busy it took them a while for some one to  take any orders from us. The service was not attentive, we had to look for the girl twice. As they were so busy cleaning up for the night while people were trying to eat. Bathroom unkept and bottomless fries were 12 sent per order. Will not be back. 2 stars for food.

Mediocre burgers and service. When I pointed out that my steamed broccoli was brown, waitress said it must have been over cooked. It was clearly rotten. Waitress disappeared for quite a long time and when she finally came back to the table, she wreaked of cigarette smoke!!  How unprofessional!  Not worth the premium prices.

This is a mixed review. Had a short wait so went to the bar. Bartender was great. Sat and our waiter was rather attentive at first. Ordered drinks and an appetizer then looked at the menu. Placed our order and then waited. And waited and waited. Finally flagged down the waiter and asked where our appetizer was. He went to check on it and came back to say he forgot to put it in and asked if we still wanted it. We said yes. 2 minutes later our dinner came out. Several minutes later our appetizer came out. Restroom had no toilet paper and one of the locks was completely broken off. Food was excellent, not even an apology on forgetting the appetizer. It wasn't busy at all. In my opinion restaurant is not well taken care of and the service was poor. However the food is very good so will debate on coming back. We have had excellent service in the past.

I feel very torn writing this review because I can't help but to wonder if they are short staffed or if the management has become shoddy. The last 3 times we have been in the last 6 ms has been awful. The service has been very bad. One particular time, we ordered the OMG Nachos which were very skimpy with hardly anything on them for 10$. They were also cold. Server seemed to have too many tables. It took her a long time to come check on us and for us to send them back to get something different.  Last time, our server was in charge of a big table behind us that appeared to have many problems to the point that a manager had to assist. It totally took over her attention. We were neglected. We maybe saw her twice. Our appetizer came out before our drinks did. Our food was brought out by other servers with things missing. Usually your server comes to see you shortly to make sure you have all you need. She never did. We decided to eat it anyway so it wouldn't get cold but none of us had any more drinks and we were scared to eat unless we had something to drink since she had proved to be so preoccupied. I finally stopped the hostess and asked her to please help us and told her what we were dealing with. One would think she would tell a server or manager but she didn't. Just brought us drinks so we could eat. 1st time we have never left a tip.  We have since move to TN and the experience at the one in Mt. Juliet, before we moved and since,  just always does a 5 star job. Not sure what's going on with the one in Gville.

It's a good burger, but the restaurant feels dirty. The tables and chairs and surfaces just all feel gross. It's loud too. We went on a night where there were EIGHT birthday songs sang by the staff. Ugh.

This place has real delicious burgers but you rarely get good service. The servers are always in a rush maybe because they are responsible for too many tables but the service is always bad. I wish they work on that.

Good atmosphere, nice bar area, good for crowds but on the expensive side for a hamburger restaurant.  My wife and I along with one son had three burgers with fries and two sodas and the bill was $49.09 so with a tip, its about $58  for LUNCH.....for HAMBURGERS. C'Mon Man! I like the burgers, they are very creative with their topping and presentation, but they are pricey. The service was good, but I do understand what the other reviews say about the hustle and bustle and it could be an issue.  The only issue I had was getting water refill.  I ordered the Burning Love burger, which is a burger topped with fried jalapeño coins, salsa, Pepper-Jack, lettuce, tomatoes and chipotle aioli on a jalapeño-cornmeal kaiser roll.  I also ordered it with "some pink" but it was "no pink" (that was the server's terminology).  It was $10.89.  My guests had a black and bleu angus burger each and they were $14.89 each.  My burger arrived with a char grilled large jalapeno pepper pinned to the top of it.  It looked really cool but was pretty hot, so about mid way through eating it, the server stopped by to refill my water.  This means they take your glass away to go and refill it elsewhere. Not normally a problem, right?  Unless they don't come back and your eating a giant char grilled jalapeno that looks really cool...waiting....waiting..and here she comes with someone else food an not with my water.  I did get it after probably 5 minutes but that was an uncomfortable five minutes and my fries were fairly dry too.  Burger was kind of dry too, wound up dipping the last few bites into ketchup since that outer edge had run out of the chipotle aioli. Decent burger but you cannot eat enough bottomless fries to make up for the pricetag.

Lots of focus on the burger toppings. Could use a better and fresher burger patty. Restaurant was busy, so it's understandable that there may be some wait for the food getting to the table. But it still seemed longer than usual for three burgers.  Still, food was good. Service was decent. Will return in the future.

This review is based on my meal. Two of the four of us had issues, two did not. The good was a BLTA.  Basically a turkey club on a  croissant.  She was very happy with the sandwich and the sweet potato fries. I had a tavern double burger. Sweet, juicey and tasty. The bad, one other person received their bacon cheeseburger without the bacon. Come on people! And the other statesd her burger was dry. Nice place inside, and a nice bar area. But with the competition in the fancy burger business, they need to step up their game. Price wise it falls into the high side. Hostess service was ok. Wait staff was attentive. I will go back, but there are plenty of like places popping up all over.
The food was good if not overpriced. The ORIGINAL  waitress  ignored us and another waitress brought our food out.  We had to wait for our  'bottomless fries'.  The fries were greasy and overdone.

A friend knows I love fish and chips and she told me that Red Robin's were the best in the area. I had heard some positive things about RR from other people so I was excited to get a chance to go and try them out. However, my experience was so bad that I will NOT go back.  The problem seems to be in their service model rather than the food. Here's my story: The fish was nicely done and crisp the way I like it. I got four  pieces about 4 inches long and 2 inches wide. $13+ was a little pricey, but I can let that slide. Their dish also comes with bottomless fries, and that was where the first problem developed. The first round of bottomless fries were like scrapings from the kitchen. Little chunks of potatoes and a few so-so fries. There were not many (hidden under the fish) so they disappeared quickly. So did the server!  My wife and I (she ordered the same dish) each wanted more, per the bottomless fries promise, but our server was not to be found. Finally I got up and went to the staging area / staff lounge and explained that I could not find my server and needed more fries. They said they would bring more fries right away. Many minutes later, our server appeared with ONE tiny tray of fries (perhaps a dozen total). I had asked for two. She grunted and went to get another which she brought back within a minute or two. She explained that she had several tables all around the restaurant and that's why I couldn't find her. Indeed, we never saw her again for 10 more minutes, at which time I walked over to her and again asked for TWO servings of fries. To her credit she brought them right away.  The next time I saw her was when she brought the bill ... and finally filled our empty glasses of water. Nobody had refilled our initial glass of water for 25 minutes! Then, as I went to pay using the required tabletop credit card processor, I did not get a receipt because it was stuck or out of paper. Think I could fine our server? NO! We were done so I asked for a manager and requested a copy of my receipt, a process that took him 4-5 minutes. I also explained to him the issues we had and he said he was sorry and just looked at  me like it was no surprise. In retrospect, I think the biggest issue is that they seem to scatter their servers around the restaurant. I know that is a more antiquated business model still used by a few chains. I never have understood why some restaurants think that is better than having their servers work a zone and pay attention to their patrons. The "disappearing server" model is a good way to irritate a lot of people.  My guess is that this restaurant chain continues because the food is quite tasty if you don't need any service from the time the food arrives until you are ready to leave. In Greenville, we have better options and I will let my money speak elsewhere!

This is the second time I have visited this location while in Greenville,SC. It is located along a major thoroughfare, with plenty of parking. Our visit was great. Kevin our server was humorous and great as a server. Our food came quickly, it was hot and delicious. Kevin was quick with the refills and offered to go beverages. Will visit again when in the area.

We had not been to Red Robin in quite awhile due to a bad experience, well that has definitely changed. From the time we walked in till we walked out they had excellent customer service. Casey took care of us and she was fantastic. I had the build your own with fruit and my daughter had the BBQ bacon. Our only regret was we didn't share . These are big burgers. My daughter was offered more fries and I more fruit but we declined as we couldn't finish what we had . They have a extensive drink menu to please everyone. If you find room , the dessert menu looked amazing. We will not wait so long to return.
The waitress was great, but the food was mediocre at best and the presentation was terrible. Shouldn't be serving food on broken plates. Dissatisfied with my visit.

This is now my third time going to this restaurant. Each time my experience has been bad. Seems this time there was no silverware. I ordered a Red Robin burger and got a plain burger. The waitress carried it to the back then brought it out the same. I sent it back and the manager was supposed to come out but never showed up. We finally left. The restaurant was dirty. Not impressed- especially since Red Robin is one of my favorite places. Very sad at the standard and quality.
